data.title: When will Kenneth Branagh get his Oscar? - Washington County Cooperative Library Services
data.meta_description:
When will Kenneth Branagh get his Oscar? by Hillsboro_PaxB - a staff-created list : UPDATE: Belfast wins for Best Original Screenplay! 

During his 30+ year film career, Kenneth Branagh has been nominated in seven different Oscar categories  - more than any other filmmaker - but has yet to win any. Will he do it tonight with Belfast?  

Check out Branagh's many accoladed and/or popular works below.
data.text:
Staff-created list

UPDATE: Belfast wins for Best Original Screenplay! During his 30+ year film career, Kenneth Branagh has been nominated in seven different Oscar categories - more than any other filmmaker - but has yet to win any. Will he do it tonight with Belfast? Check out Branagh's many accoladed and/or popular works below.

Nominated for Best Picture, Best Director and WON for Best Original Screenplay in 2022. Based on Branagh's own memories of growing up in Northern Irelan...Show more Nominated for Best Picture, Best Director and WON for Best Original Screenplay in 2022. Based on Branagh's own memories of growing up in Northern Ireland during the troubles, BELFAST tells the story of a family facing a difficult decision: stay in their beloved neighborhood, or leave the country to escape the growing danger. As conflicts escalate in the street and his own parents' marriage, nine-year-old Buddy escapes through trips to the movies and wooing his childhood crush. Show less

Nominated for Best Director and Best Actor in 1990. Branagh may be best known for his many Shakespeare adaptations. In Henry V, he plays the titular king...Show more Nominated for Best Director and Best Actor in 1990. Branagh may be best known for his many Shakespeare adaptations. In Henry V, he plays the titular king who inspires his army to invade France. The play is best known for the "St. Crispin's Day" speech. Co-stars Emma Thompson. Show less

Nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay in 1997. Branagh directs the only unabridged version of Shakespeare's tragedy, reset to the 19th century. Branagh plays Hamlet, and stars alongside Derek Jacobi, Julie Christie, and Kate Winslet. Nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay in 1997. Branagh directs the only unabridged version of Shakespeare's tragedy, reset to the 19th century. Branagh plays Hamlet, and stars alongside Derek Jacobi, Julie Christie, and Kate Winslet. Show less

Nominated for Best Supporting Actor in 2012, playing Laurence Olivier in this biopic of Marilyn Monroe during her work on Olivier's film The Prince and the Showgirl. Co-stars Michelle Williams and Eddie Redmayne. Nominated for Best Supporting Actor in 2012, playing Laurence Olivier in this biopic of Marilyn Monroe during her work on Olivier's film The Prince and the Showgirl. Co-stars Michelle Williams and Eddie Redmayne. Show less

Won a BAFTA for Best Actor and Best Drama Series in 2008 and 2009, respectively. Branagh stars as Kurt Wallander, a Swedish inspector going through a personal existential crisis in this detective series. Won a BAFTA for Best Actor and Best Drama Series in 2008 and 2009, respectively. Branagh stars as Kurt Wallander, a Swedish inspector going through a personal existential crisis in this detective series. Show less

Won an Emmy for Best Lead Actor in 2001 playing an SS General planning the "Final Solution," aka the mass murder of Jews, Romani, gay, trans, and disabled people in Nazi Germany. Co stars Stanley Tucci. Won an Emmy for Best Lead Actor in 2001 playing an SS General planning the "Final Solution," aka the mass murder of Jews, Romani, gay, trans, and disabled people in Nazi Germany. Co stars Stanley Tucci. Show less

All copies in use Availability details

Emmy and BAFTA Nominated for Best Actor in 2001-2 in this biopic of Ernest Shackleton, leader of the 1914 Antarctic expedition. Emmy and BAFTA Nominated for Best Actor in 2001-2 in this biopic of Ernest Shackleton, leader of the 1914 Antarctic expedition. Show less

Branagh directs and stars as Benedick in this sun-kissed Shakespeare comedy, the quintessential enemies-to-lovers romance. Co-stars Emma Thompson, Kate Beckinsale, Denzel Washington, and Keanu Reeves. Branagh directs and stars as Benedick in this sun-kissed Shakespeare comedy, the quintessential enemies-to-lovers romance. Co-stars Emma Thompson, Kate Beckinsale, Denzel Washington, and Keanu Reeves. Show less

Branagh directed one of the first films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, introducing us to Thor, the Norse god of thunder who becomes a fish out of water...Show more Branagh directed one of the first films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, introducing us to Thor, the Norse god of thunder who becomes a fish out of water when stranded in a small Southwestern town. You can really see Branagh's Shakespearean roots here in Thor's dialogue. Show less

Hercule Poirot puts his little grey cells to work in this adaptaton of Agatha Christie's most famous work. Branagh directs and stars as the beloved Belgian detective. Hercule Poirot puts his little grey cells to work in this adaptaton of Agatha Christie's most famous work. Branagh directs and stars as the beloved Belgian detective. Show less

It's New Year's Eve, and Peter has a big announcement for his best friends. Branagh directs and stars with his own college friends Emma Thompson, Stephen Fry, Hugh Laurie, and Tony Slattery. It's New Year's Eve, and Peter has a big announcement for his best friends. Branagh directs and stars with his own college friends Emma Thompson, Stephen Fry, Hugh Laurie, and Tony Slattery. Show less

Kenneth Branagh may be best known to younger generations as the foppish and ambitious Professor Gilderoy Lockhart from Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets. Kenneth Branagh may be best known to younger generations as the foppish and ambitious Professor Gilderoy Lockhart from Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets. Show less
